snippet: As the bank reels in the court of public opinion, it has been able to stop lawsuits from defrauded customers by moving the cases to arbitration....
abstract: Wells Fargo is trying to kill lawsuits filed by customers in connection with as many as two million unauthorized or sham accounts by moving cases into private arbitration; process, which takes place outside public view, frequently favors corporations and decisions are nearly impossible to overturn; lawyers for bank’s customers say actions are aimed at limiting bank’s accountability for widespread fraud and denying customers day in court.

byline.original: By MICHAEL CORKERY and STACY COWLEY

lead_paragraph: As the bank reels in the court of public opinion, it has been able to stop lawsuits from defrauded customers by moving the cases to arbitration.

headline.main: Wells Fargo Killing Sham Account Suits by Using Arbitration
headline.print_headline: Wells Fargo Moves to Smother Lawsuits Over Sham Accounts
